metadata.title: CVE-2017-7526 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
libgcrypt before version 1.7.8 is vulnerable to a cache side-channel attackresulting into a complete break of RSA-1024 while using the left-to-rightmethod for computing the sliding-window expansion. The same attack isbelieved to work on RSA-2048 with moderately more computation. Thisside-channel requires that attacker can run arbitrary software on thehardware where the private RSA key is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt11 - 1.5.3-2ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6
gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6
gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libgcrypt11 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2ubuntu4.5').
gnupg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6').
